nodes.bodyText:
😆 You've lived a great life without Windows then ;)
Docker machine is a virtual machine that is launched in Windows systems (Home) (I think this is the same for macOS). It's an actual virtual virtual machine running Linux where Docker is hosted. Then the Docker daemon host is shared with windows environment. (Maybe check this (translated) article I wrote way back in 2015 so you understand what this is).
This sort of workaround is/was needed because Windows has no Linux Kernel and obviously Docker can't access to underlying cgroups or namespaces. So as a workaround, Docker runs on a VM and the daemon is shared with Windows. Similar to what happens eval $(minikube docker-env) if you may.
You are probably referring to Docker Swarm when talking about some sort of replacement for Kubernetes, right?

nodes.bodyText: please do keep this as real XML comments, some syntax highlighting machines will break when processing this and also this code is not copy-pasteable since that is not a valid XML syntax.
Why is this no longer a heading? did the document structure change? Maybe we want it to be an H4?
move the label (and maybe the link reference) to the top of the table where it makes sense (As a Figure title), following the _configuration.adoc pattern
